context.rdfs:comment: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).
context.rdfs:label: Person

properties.rdfs:comment: The person's spouse.
properties.rdfs:label: spouse

properties.rdfs:comment: A colleague of the person.
properties.rdfs:label: colleagues

properties.rdfs:comment: Date of death.
properties.rdfs:label: deathDate

properties.rdfs:comment: A contact location for a person's place of work.
properties.rdfs:label: workLocation

properties.rdfs:comment: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.
properties.rdfs:label: netWorth

properties.rdfs:comment: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).
properties.rdfs:label: jobTitle

properties.rdfs:comment: The place where the person died.
properties.rdfs:label: deathPlace

properties.rdfs:comment: The place where the person was born.
properties.rdfs:label: birthPlace

properties.rdfs:comment: Gender of the person. While http://schema.org/Male and http://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.
properties.rdfs:label: gender

properties.rdfs:comment: An organization that the person is an alumni of.
properties.rdfs:label: alumniOf

properties.rdfs:comment: A contact location for a person's residence.
properties.rdfs:label: homeLocation

properties.rdfs:comment: Date of birth.
properties.rdfs:label: birthDate

properties.rdfs:comment: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.
properties.rdfs:label: familyName

properties.rdfs:comment: A sibling of the person.
properties.rdfs:label: sibling

properties.rdfs:comment: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.
properties.rdfs:label: performerIn

properties.rdfs:comment: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.
properties.rdfs:label: honorificPrefix

properties.rdfs:comment: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.
properties.rdfs:label: additionalName

properties.rdfs:comment: A sibling of the person.
properties.rdfs:label: siblings

properties.rdfs:comment: A colleague of the person.
properties.rdfs:label: colleague

properties.rdfs:comment: A child of the person.
properties.rdfs:label: children

properties.rdfs:comment: A parents of the person.
properties.rdfs:label: parents

properties.rdfs:comment: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.
properties.rdfs:label: givenName

properties.rdfs:comment: A parent of this person.
properties.rdfs:label: parent

properties.rdfs:comment: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.
properties.rdfs:label: affiliation

properties.rdfs:comment: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.
properties.rdfs:label: honorificSuffix

properties.rdfs:comment: Nationality of the person.
properties.rdfs:label: nationality

properties.rdfs:comment: The most generic familial relation.
properties.rdfs:label: relatedTo

properties.rdfs:comment: The most generic uni-directional social relation.
properties.rdfs:label: follows

properties.rdfs:comment: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.
properties.rdfs:label: knows

properties.rdfs:comment: Organizations that the person works for.
properties.rdfs:label: worksFor
